member.summary: Provides for immediate loading and filtering of related data.

member.summary: Default value for MaxResultsLimit

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.FetchOptimization.FetchStrategy.DefaultMaxFetchDepth
member.summary: Default value for MaxFetchDepth

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.FetchOptimization.FetchStrategy.LoadWith``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,System.Object}})
member.summary: Specifies which sub-objects to retrieve when a query is submitted for an object of type T.
member.typeparam: Type that is queried against.
member.param: Identifies the field or property to be retrieved.The expression should identify a field or property that represents a one-to-one or one-to-many relationship. The expression is of type <Type> => <Type>.<Member>.
member.remarks: You cannot specify the loading of two levels of relationships (for example, Orders.OrderDetails). In these scenarios you must specify two separate LoadWith methods.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.FetchOptimization.FetchStrategy.LoadWith(System.Linq.Expressions.LambdaExpression)
member.summary: Retrieves specified data related to the main target by using a lambda expression.
member.param: A lambda expression that identifies the related material.
member.remarks: You cannot specify the loading of two levels of relationships (for example, Orders.OrderDetails). In these scenarios you must specify two separate LoadWith methods or use the overload LoadWith<T>(params Expression<Func<T, object>>[] args).

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.FetchOptimization.FetchStrategy.LoadWith``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,System.Object}}[])
member.summary: Specifies which sub-objects to retrieve by using a variable number of expressions.
member.typeparam: Type that is queried against.
member.param: A variable number of expressions that identify the fields or properties to be retrieved. The expressions should identify fields or properties that represent one-to-one or one-to-many relationships.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.FetchOptimization.FetchStrategy.LoadWith(System.Linq.Expressions.LambdaExpression[])
member.summary: Retrieves specified data related to the main target by using a variable number of lambda expressions.
member.param: A variable number of lambda expressions that identify the related material.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.FetchOptimization.FetchStrategy.MaxFetchDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets tha maximum fetch depth. The MaxFetchDepth determines how "deep" into the object graph to traverse when loading an instance. For example, with a MaxFetchDepth of 2, OpenAccess will load at most the target instance and its immediate relations. With a MaxFetchDepth of 3, OpenAccess may load the target instance, its immediate relations, and the relations of those relations.
member.remarks: The value must be >=1 and the default one is 3. The maximum possible value depends on the database server and the class hierarchy depth and is bound by the number of SQL joins required.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.FetchOptimization.FetchStrategy.MaxResultsLimit
member.summary: Limits the maximum number of instances to return by query execution.
member.remarks: This property can be used for performance optimizations, if not all instances matching the query are required.

member.summary: Gets the number of user defined fetch strategy fragments

member.remarks: This is the main entry point for constructing dynamic LINQ queries with OpenAccess. Typically, this is used for queries on Artificial Types together with the System.Linq.Dynamic.DynamicQueryable extension methods. To express queries on artificial fields, the extension method can be used. A slightly modified version of the DynamicQueryable class is provided in the source folder.

member.returns: IQueryable instance that can be used to express dynamic queries.

member.remarks: This is a tagging method that will be translated into the correct SQL LIKE statements where the * and ? wildcards need to be translated into backend specific wildcards (typically % and _). You can escape the * and ? characters by prefixing them with a single backslash.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ExtensionMethods.SQL``1(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Provides a SQL fragment to a LINQ expression.
member.remarks:
Puts the given SQL fragment into the SQL that is generated by the surrounding LINQ expression. This can be quite useful when an unmapped server side function needs to be used in a LINQ expression.
In order to reference domain model fields symbolically and map them to to their columns, the can be used and referenced from the in a like style : {0} references the SQL generated by the mapping of the first parameter, {1} the SQL for the second parameter, ... .
The provided SQL fragment is not able to change the principal structure of the SQL that gets generated by the LINQ expression.
The following example shows how to incorporate a SQL fragment to test for a fulltext condition; it will require a fulltext index to be present and populated and is specific to MSSQL.
string fulltextCondition = "\"Vin*\""; var q = from o in Orders where "CONTAINS({0},{1})".SQL<bool>(o.ShipName, fulltextCondition) select o;
The LINQ expression will incorporate the given SQL fragment and reference the column that is backing the ShipName property (or field) and provide the parameter to the CONTAINS fulltext method.
member.typeparam: The type that the island generates in the database server.
member.param: The SQL fragment that will be placed into the generated SQL query.
The arguments as referenced by the .
member.returns: SQL expression with the specified type

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ExtensionMethods.Include``1(System.Linq.IQueryable{``0},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,System.Object}})
member.summary: Specifies which sub-objects to load additionally in the query result by using an expressions that specifies the path needed.
member.typeparam: Source query element type
member.param: An expressions that identifies the field or property to be loaded. The expression should identify a field or property that represents a relationship or a non-default fetch group field.
OpenAccess query

remarks.para: In case the passed instance is not an OpenAccess query, there is no effect.
There can be multiple Include statements in a LINQ query.
When Include is specified, the of the OpenAccessContext is ignored.
When Include is specified, a cannot be specified with the method; these fetch description approaches exclude each other.
An Include cannot be made after a non-trivial projection.
When neither an nor a was used for a query, the default of the context is used.

member.exception: When a FetchStrategy was already specified for the query.
member.returns: New query instance that will include additional objects.

member.summary: Specifies a fetch strategy to be used with this query.

remarks.para: A defines which additional objects should be loaded by an action.
When LoadWith is used, the of the OpenAccessContext is ignored.
LoadWith cannot be used with in one query; these fetch description approaches exclude each other.
When neither an nor a was used for a query, the default of the context is used.

member.typeparam: Source query element type
member.param: OpenAccess query
FetchStrategy that should be used
member.exception: When an Include was already specified for the query.
member.returns: New query instance that will include additional objects.

member.remarks: This interface allows to configure the dynamic behavior of a LINQ query.
member.typeparam: Type of the results set elements

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ExtentQuery`1.ParallelFetch(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines whether parallel result fetching is allowed.
member.remarks: Parallel fetching allow the efficient retrieval of a single collection field from the result set elements.
member.param: True when parallel fetching is to be allowed (Default: False)

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ExtentQuery`1.IgnoreUncommitted(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines whether the query execution is allowed to ignore the changes made in the current transaction.
member.remarks: When the query is set to not ignore uncommitted changes, the content of the current transaction will be flushed (but not yet committed) to the database server. After that, objects deleted, changed or inserted in the current transaction will be visible to the query and the result will reflect the (uncommitted) changes.
member.param: True when uncommitted changes are ignored. (Default: True)

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ExtentQuery`1.ForwardsOnly(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines whether the query result can be traversed forwards only, or if random access is possible.
member.remarks: Normal LINQ applications rarely have the need to change the behavior to random access as LINQ queries tend to favor forward reading.
member.param: True when the result set is accessed in a forward iterating manner only. (Default: True>
